block.p: Sara Christian Holt, the daughter of Becky Schoepfle-Williams of Fairfax, Va., and Leahman Holt of Centreville, Va., was married yesterday to Nathaniel Maurice Zilkha, the son of Frances and Daniel A. Zilkha of Portland, Me. The Rev. Charles G. Newbery, an Episcopal priest, officiated in the garden of the home of Gabrielle Sheshunoff, a friend of the Zilkha family in Prouts Neck, Me.

Mrs. Zilkha, 25, is a fund-raising associate at the Lower East Side Girls Club, the nonprofit organization in New York. She graduated from James Madison University and is a candidate for a master's degree in nonprofit management at New School University. Her father is an assistant principal at Chantilly High School in Chantilly, Va. Her mother works in Washington as the director of operations for Quadel Consulting, which manages and develops low-income housing programs. The bride is the stepdaughter of John Williams and of Karen Holt.
Sara Christian Holt was married yesterday to Nathaniel Maurice Zilkha in the garden of the home of Gabrielle Sheshunoff, a friend of the Zilkha family in Prouts Neck, Me.

Sara Christian Holt, the daughter of Becky Schoepfle-Williams of Fairfax, Va., and Leahman Holt of Centreville, Va., was married yesterday to Nathaniel Maurice Zilkha, the son of Frances and Daniel A. Zilkha of Portland, Me. The Rev. Charles G. Newbery, an Episcopal priest, officiated in the garden of the home of Gabrielle Sheshunoff, a friend of the Zilkha family in Prouts Neck, Me.

Mrs. Zilkha, 25, is a fund-raising associate at the Lower East Side Girls Club, the nonprofit organization in New York. She graduated from James Madison University and is a candidate for a master's degree in nonprofit management at New School University. Her father is an assistant principal at Chantilly High School in Chantilly, Va. Her mother works in Washington as the director of operations for Quadel Consulting, which manages and develops low-income housing programs. The bride is the stepdaughter of John Williams and of Karen Holt.

Mr. Zilkha, 28, is an associate who analyzes and manages investments for the merchant banking division of Goldman Sachs in New York. He graduated cum laude from Princeton. His mother is a member of the board of the Portland String Quartet and a trustee of the Academic Council for Post-Holocaust Christian, Jewish and Islamic Studies, which is affiliated with the University of Maine in Portland. His father, who was the founder and former chairman of Art & Auction magazine in New York, is the chief executive of Sabre Yachts, which manufactures sailing and motor yachts in South Casco, Me.
